intro: Pseudodracontium kuznetsovii, commonly known as the Kuznetsov's pseudodracontium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments within tropical and subtropical forests. Its botanical features include palmately divided leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that develop into berries. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
